abstract.t: Documents in the RFC series normally use only plain-text ASCII characters and a fixed-width font. However, there is sometimes a need to supplement the ASCII text with graphics or picture images. The historic solution to this requirement, allowing secondary PDF and Postscript files, is seldom used because it is awkward for authors and publisher. This memo sugests a more convenient scheme for attaching authoritative diagrams, illustrations, equations or other graphics to RFCs.
